info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:11PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Transylvania and southwestern Henderson Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 111 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southeast of Brevard, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brevard, Etowah, Dupont State Forest, Laurel Park, Little River In Transylvania County, Horse Shoe, Penrose, Connestee, Crab Creek and Cedar Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
